abstracts.cdata!:
The SCARP Transition and Improvement
            Project will be the pilot phase of a  salinity control and
            reclamation project (SCARP) transition program to privatize
            ground water development in SCARP areas having adequate
            quality fresh groundwater. If proven feasible in the pilot
            phase, the program will be expanded to cover up to four
            million acres, and involve 7,500 public tubewells. The
            project objectives are to develop a replicable package of
            technical and institutional components for: (i) implementing
            Government policy of transferring the resposibility for
            groundwater pumpage in order to meet effectively both
            irrigation and drainage requirements; (ii) confirming that
            farmers, particularly smallholders, will be willing and able
            to participate in the privatization of groundwater
            development; and (iii) increasing agricultural production
            and farm incomes through improved use of surface and
            groundwater supplies, which are used conjunctively by farmers.
